radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild thickening and increased enhancement of the wall of the terminal ileum and ascending colon, consistent with ileocolitis. Multiple subpleural lung nodules, measuring up to 13 mm with central hypoattenuation.
Additional bilateral pulmonary nodules in a subpleural distribution, measuring up to 13 mm. Several nodules had central hypoattenuation, and other nodules had indistinct margins.
FDG avidity in many lung nodules indicating increased glucose metabolism; no abnormal extrathoracic uptake.
Several nodules had increased in size while others had shrunk, indicating a non-malignant process.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Waxing and waning pattern of growth suggests no malignant process.
